Text.Value: Don't you dare turn this on me, Rolan.

EditorData.NodeContext: furious - rolan is trying to blame her brother's death on her

Text.Value: He's no brother of mine.

EditorData.NodeContext: being horribly cruel to his brother, saying this to hurt him

Text.Value: Well, we'll never know, will be? Because Cal had one job - protect her. And he failed - miserably.

EditorData.NodeContext: furious, grief-stricken

Text.Value: Enough. I won't say it again.

EditorData.NodeContext: lia is two seconds away from drawing a blade on her own brother. Furious, upset and on the brink of losing it

Text.Value: Lia is alive - you should be grateful.
SHUT UP, BOTH OF YOU, BEFORE I FINISH WHAT KETHERIC STARTED.
Am I going to get paid or what?
I return from the darkness itself only to find you acting like you're on holiday. Lia could still be in Moonrise!

EditorData.NodeContext: furious and accusatory. His sister is dead and in his grief and anger he is blaming his brother cal

Text.Value: Do you wish it was me who died? Instead of Lia?

EditorData.NodeContext: small voice. He blames himself for lia's death, he's upset and on the brink of breaking down

Text.Value: I thought my entire family was DEAD.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Eyes downcast at end of line, doesn't want to make eye contact with anyone
EditorData.NodeContext: shouting - incredibly emotional. Eyes downcast at end of line, doesn't want to make eye contact with anyone

Text.Value: Rolan, we're alive because of her - don't be like that.
Rolan, we're alive because of him - don't be like that.
Rolan, we're alive because of them - don't be like that.

EditorData.NodeContext: nervous, trying to dispel the situation.

Text.Value: Don't you dare. Lia was his responsibility, and he failed her.

EditorData.NodeContext: being horribly cruel to his brother, saying this to hurt him

Text.Value: I was just... overwhelmed. It doesn't matter.

EditorData.NodeContext: very emotional, looking away, ashamed of how lost he was without his family

Text.Value: Where in the Nine Hells have you been?

EditorData.NodeContext: frustrated and accusatory - rolan was worried sick but instead of showing it he is being a dick

Text.Value: You two did what you thought was right, but I can't go through this again. I just can't.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad and emotional, looking away at the end of line as he tries to calm down

RuleGroup.RuleString: !(MONK and SORCERER and WARLOCK and WIZARD)

Text.Value: You want to blame someone for Lia's death? Blame me.
Me too.

EditorData.NodeContext: voice thick with emotion but also glad that rolan apologised - things will be okay

Text.Value: And when others, such as myself, failed miserably.

EditorData.NodeContext: a rare moment in which he is sincere, genuine and thankful to the player

Text.Value: All the magic in the world could not have saved Lia. Not yours - and not mine.
Anything to add, Rolan?
Rolan was in a bad state without you two.
Shit. I'm sorry.

EditorData.NodeContext: disgusted with himself and what he's just said. Looking away, sincere apology

Text.Value: Rolan, please.

EditorData.NodeContext: upset, tears threatening

Text.Value: Am I supposed to pretend that everything is fine? That Lia isn't dead?

EditorData.NodeContext: frustrated, part of him realises he's being an ass which is why he's being defensive

Text.Value: I return from the darkness itself only to find you at ease while Cal lies dead. What in the hells did you do?

EditorData.NodeContext: furious and accusatory. His brother is dead and in his grief and anger he is blaming his sister lia

Text.Value: How about I kill you both, so you can join Lia? I'll even say your last rites.
Getting captured was stupid and reckless.
Here - take this and leave. You can go now.

EditorData.NodeContext: dismissive and condescending

Text.Value: I've lashed out at you, drunkenly and otherwise, and you helped anyway.

EditorData.NodeContext: a rare moment in which he is sincere, genuine and thankful to the player

Text.Value: What do you mean Cal is dead? What did you do?

EditorData.NodeContext: furious and accusatory. His brother is dead and hin his giref and anger he is blaming his sister lia

Text.Value: I thought you were dead, you ass. Both of you!

EditorData.NodeContext: frustration tinged with upset - getting emotional

Text.Value: That's more than fair. Thank you for helping us when most wouldn't.

EditorData.NodeContext: sincere and genuine - said with a smile

Text.Value: Did you enjoy relaxing here while I battled that wretched darkness? What were you thinking?

EditorData.NodeContext: Snarky and frustrated - rolan was worried sick but instead of showing it he is being a dick

Text.Value: I know, all right? But I couldn't stand back and do nothing.

EditorData.NodeContext: frustrated and emotional, trying to explain herself

Text.Value: Don't be an arsehole, Rolan. He's your brother.
And who's fault is that?

EditorData.NodeContext: more sad than angry, clearly calming down but not ready to let the anger go yet

Text.Value: Or, we could remember how brave, and kind, and smart he was - every single day. That's my plan, anyway.

EditorData.NodeContext: grieving but also a smile at the thought of her brother.

Text.Value: Could you give us a moment? Please?

EditorData.NodeContext: nervous, trying to calm the situation

Text.Value: Peace - your brother is dead, but he is not gone. He is safe now, and at peace.
I'm sorry too.

EditorData.NodeContext: upset - voice thick with grief and shame

Text.Value: Sorry for... yelling. Here - I hope this helps down the road. And thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: generic handing motion. Emotive, embarassed in the first line, grateful and sincere in the last

Text.Value: So, who is paying me?
Thank you - for saving me. And the two idiots.

EditorData.NodeContext: cheerful and grateful, trying to dispel the tension in the room. Idiots said with affection

Text.Value: Did you even try to save Cal?

EditorData.NodeContext: accusatory, furious in his grief.

Text.Value: Breathe. Think. This is no time for harsh words - you only have each other now.

Text.Value: No - no, it's not your fault. I shouldn't have shouted - I'm sorry.

Text.Value: I'm sorry - we should have been here.

Synopsis: Cal and/or Lia have been rescued from Moonrise towers and reunited with Rolan in Last Light Inn. It is initially a tense scene - Rolan was worried sick/is angry one of his siblings is dead and is taking it out on his family. It is up to the player to calm them down and remind them of what is important - family.
